descriptionHtml:
Its a another profile manager to add to the list of others.  I made one for my cousin and thought of sharing it so here it is.
this is a beta release so please back up all save files.
[size=4][b]Features[/b][/size]
[b][size=2]
[/size][/b][list]
[*][b][size=2]Profile Creation[/size][/b]
[*][b][size=2]Profile Switching[/size][/b]
[*][b][size=2]Auto Save Segregation(Will not move Autosave and Quicksave) [color=red]*Experimental[/color][/size][/b]
[*][b][color=red][size=2][color=#ffff00]Supports Mod Organizer Launch[/color][/size][/color][/b]
[/list]
[color=#ff0000]
[size=3][b]*Please back up saves before using. It works in my computer and in my cousin's computer but I don't know
 how it will affect your save files.[/b][/size][/color]
[size=4]
Installation:[/size]
Just unzip it in your Skyrim main folder and run.
Click the config button(Wrench and Screwdriver).
Look for "Launcher Button" drop down and look for your launch style.
Click ok in configuration then click the Skyrim logo

If placed in a different folder you have to manually locate the exes[b]
[/b]Mod Organizer has to be manually located

[size=4]Uninstall:[/size]
Delete SkyrimSaveApp.exe and SkyrimSaveAppConfig.ini

[b][size=4]FAQ[/size]

Q: [/b]Why is the "Launcher Button" Drop down List Empty
[b]A:[/b] None of your Exe files where located. you probably placed the program somewhere else.
    To solve click configuration button then Manually search each of them by clicking the [...] buttons one by one

[b]Q:[/b] It says on the website it supports Mod Organizer yet when i click the Skyrim logo it launches without the mods attached to MO?
[b]A:[/b] Make sure that Mod Organizer under the configuration is not empty and You selected [i]"Launcher via Mod Organizer"[/i] or [i]"SKSE via Mod Organizer[/i]" under           the Launcher Button

Q: I thought this program will auto separate my character save file?
A: The button to separate characters is located at the configuration menu. This is experimental you have been warned here and later within the
     program.

Q: Where are the profiles saved?
A: it's in your "Skyrim" folder in my documents, it's saved under the "Save Storage" folder

Q: Great my saves are gone thanks to this program.
A: Is that a question or a statement? anyway to answer this as stated earlier this file is still on its beta testing  so you should back up files before using.
     It works on my end I don't know how it will work in yours.

[b]Q:[/b] Why does it look so plain and ugly?
[b]A:[/b] First I'm no artist, second I prefer function over looks but mostly I just suck at art..

Q: where would I post if I have a question or I would like to report a bug?
A: put it in the comment section.
author: Macpatch
